definition: fine hair grown by animals (or down grown by birds) in the fall/(fig.) sth barely discernible/the slightest thing/the minutest detail
hair/drawing brush/(in the) least/one thousandth/currency unit, 0.1 yuan
lit. seeing clearly the downy feathers of autumn (idiom, from Mencius)/fig. perceptive of even the finest detail
(idiom) (of soldiers) highly disciplined, not committing the slightest offence against civilians

sentences.english: He has a good eye for detail and notices almost everything.
sentences.chinese: 他明察秋毫，几乎一切事情都注意到了。

sentences.english: At this level, in a game of this importance, you expect to be given a referee that can see that.
sentences.chinese: 在这样重要的比赛中你希望裁判都能明察秋毫。

sentences.english: Everything is seen as clear as crystal to the judge.
sentences.chinese: 这位法官真是明察秋毫。

sentences.english: Very soon, however, his look became keen and penetrative.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他的目光很快就变得犀利而明察秋毫了。

sentences.english: Living quite minute to finish the magical power now to make the farmland large to too feel unimaginable.
sentences.chinese: 生秋毫毕现的神通让田宏也感觉到不可思议。

sentences.english: The insight into very minute is each ultimate end target that fix a .
sentences.chinese: 洞察秋毫是每一个修道者的终极目标。

sentences.english: It it said that love is blind but friendship is clairvoyant.
sentences.chinese: 据说爱情让人盲目，但友谊却让人明察秋毫。

sentences.english: The trouble with the thesis is that it strains at a gnat and swallows a camel.
sentences.chinese: 这篇论文的毛病是明察秋毫而不见舆薪。

sentences.english: Someone has to be first to get the news, and some people have quicker insights than others.
sentences.chinese: 总有人第一个得到消息，有些人更明察秋毫。

sentences.english: Seeing the troops not encroaching on the local people’s interests in the least the villagers who had been hiding in the mountains came back home one after another.
sentences.chinese: 看到部队秋毫无犯，躲到山上的村民陆续回到家中。

sentences.english: However, this small action, has long been the Tang Dynasty discover the minutest detail in everything.
sentences.chinese: 可是，这点小动作，早已被唐朝明察秋毫了。

sentences.english: It's, it's really intuition and instinct because of all the different things you're sensing.
sentences.chinese: 真正的直觉是来自你对不同事物的明察秋毫。

definition: one tiny clue reveals the general trend (idiom); small beginnings show how things will develop
different/unique/special/very/(classical) to behead/to die/to cut off/to separate/to surpass
the sun and moon/day and month/every day and every month/season/life and livelihood
